questions.text:
Find out the true and false statements

A. Drug Transport across the cell membrane is mainly by active transport-

B. Alcohol is eliminated from body by 1st order kinetic- 

C. In competitive inhibition potency decreases but efficacy remain same

D. therapeutic index indicates safety of the drug 

E. Continuous exposure of a receptor to antagonist results in down regulation of receptor
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Drug Transport across the cell membrane is mainly by passive diffusion

Alcohol is eliminated from body by zero order kinetic- 

 In competitive inhibition potency decreases but efficacy remain same

therapeutic index indicates safety of the drug 

Continuous exposure of a receptor to antagonist results in up regulation of receptors

questions.text: A 59-year-old man with acute coronary syndrome is admitted to the hospital for emergency percutaneous insertion of a coronary scent. Which of the following drugs might cause unexpected results based on the patient's CYP2C19 genotype?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Clopidogrel is a prodrug that must be metabolized to an active platelet-inhibiting metabolite by CYP2C19. Poor metabolizers achieve inadequate platelet inhibition, and EMs and UMs may have excess effect and bleed. Prasugrel and ticagrelor do not require P450 activation and are not subject to this risk.

questions.text: Which of the following drugs, if used chronically, is most likely to increase the toxicity of acetaminophen?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Acetaminophen is normally eliminated by phase II conjugation
reactions. The drug's toxicity is caused by an oxidized
reactive metabolite produced by phase I oxidizing P450
enzymes. Ethanol and certain other drugs induce P450
enzymes and thus reduce the hepatotoxic dose. Alcoholic cirrhosis reduces the hepatotoxic dose even more.

questions.text: All of the following drugs are P glycoprotein inhibitors except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

P glycoprotein Inhibitors- quinidine, verapamil, valspodar, spironolactone, clarithromycin, and ritonavir

Inducer- rifampicin, st johs wort

questions.solution:

Acid drugs binds with albumin

In hypo albuminemia (nephrotic syndrome( free level of acidic drugs will be high)

Alkali drugs binds with alpha 1 acid glycoprotein
Drugs having large volume of distribution are seen in cellular compartment, so there is no role for dialysis for drugs having large volume of distribution

questions.solution:

Metabotropic receptors mean GPCR
Salbutamol is the beta 2 receptor stimulant, all beta receptors are GPCR ( Gs)
Isulin acting enzyme (tyrosine kinase) linked receptor
Diazepam acting cell membrane receptor opening chloride channel ( ligand gated receptor)
Thyroxin acts on nuclear receptor

choices.text: Drug B is more potent than drug C and more effective than drug A
Drug A is more potent than drug B and more effective than drug C

questions.text:
Prior to clinical trials in patients with heart failure, an animal study was carried out to compare two new positive inotropic drugs (A and B) to a current standard agent (C). The results of cardiac output measurements are shown in the graph below.

Which of the following statements is correct?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)


Drug A produces 50% of its maximal effect at a lower dose
than either B or C and thus is the most potent; drug C is the
least potent. However, drug A, a partial agonist, is less efficacious
than drugs B and C.

choices.text: Is more ionized inside cells than in plasma.

questions.text: The volume of distribution of a drug will be greater if the Drug
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 is more ionized inside cells than in
plasma. When a drug is more ionized inside cells, the
drug becomes sequestered in the cells, and the volume
of distribution can become quite large. This is called ion
trapping

questions.text:
An advertisement in a local newspaper seeks to enroll 20 patients with arthritis in a medical study that would be the first time that a new drug would be tested in persons
with this disease. The study would therefore be classified as a
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Phase II clinical study. Phase II studies are done in a small group of test subjects who have the disease state targeted by the new drug. Phase I studies are
done to establish safety and pharmacokinetics in healthy subjects, often students in the health professions. Phase III studies are large, multicenter studies in patients with the disease state. Phase IV studies are post marketing surveillance, in which physicians report adverse effects to the FDA. There is no Phase V in the drug development process.

questions.text:
Intravenous administration of epinephrine to a patient result in a severe decrease in diastolic pressure and an increase in cardiac output. Which of the following drugs might
the patient has previously taken that could account for this unexpected effect?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Prazosin

questions.text: Which of the following is a direct-acting cholinomimetic that is lipid-soluble and is used to facilitate smoking cessation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Varenicline is a lipid-soluble partial agonist at nicotinic receptors and is used to reduce craving for tobacco in smokers.

questions.text: Which of the following is the most dangerous effect of bdladonna alkaloids in infants and toddlers?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

In infants, however, the most dangerous effect is
hyperthermia. Deaths with body temperatures in excess of
42 ·c have occurred after the use of atropine-containing eye
drops in children.

questions.solution:

Botulimum toxin – inhibits release of Ach

Vesamicol- inhibits vesicular uptake of Ach

Hemicholinium – inhibits choline uptake

Neostigmine- is the cholinesterase inhibitor

Pirenzepine, telenzepine- M1 blocker useful in gastric ulcer

questions.text:
Find out the true/ false statements
 
1.    Hyosine is the CNS stimulant

2.    Benzatropine is the central anticholinergic drug

3.    Valathamate is the cholinergic agonist

4.    Glycopyrolate is the quartanary ammonium compound

5.    Trospium chloride is the lipid soluble anti cholinergic agent
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Hyosine is the CNS depressant, useful in motion sickness and narco analysis
Benzatropine is the central anticholinergic drug, useful in treating drug induced EPS
Valathamate is the anti-cholinergic, useful for cervical ripening 
Glycopyrolate is the anti-cholinergic agent, useful in pre anaesthetic medication, it is the quaternary ammonium compound (lipid insoluble), no CNS adverse effects
Trospium chloride is the lipid insoluble anti cholinergic agent, does not cross BBB

3rd generation beta blockers( beta blocker with addition properties)

Alpha agonist, beta blockers, carbonic anhydrase inhibitors

Pilocarpine, netarsudil

PGF2 aloha agonist, adrenergic agonist

questions.text:
A man with diabetic autonomic neuropathy complains of dizziness and fainting when arising from bed in the morning. Which drug would be most beneficial to this
patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)


midodrine. Midodrine is an alphareceptor
agonist that is used to treat postural (orthostatic)
hypotension. Dobutamine (A) is a β1-adrenoceptor agonist
used to treat acute heart failure, while albuterol (B)
is a β2-adrenoceptor agonist employed as a bronchodilator.
Clonidine is an α2-adrenoceptor agonist used to treat
hypertension, and isoproterenol (E) is a non-selective
beta-adrenoceptor agonist.

questions.text: A child with asthma is being treated with albuterol to prevent bronchospasm. Which side effect is typically associated with this drug?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


rapid heart rate. β2-Adrenoceptor agonists
such as albuterol are used to relax bronchial smooth
muscle and prevent bronchospasm in persons with
asthma. These drugs also activate β-adrenoceptors in the
heart and increase heart rate but do not typically cause
sedation (A), muscle weakness (C), low blood pressure
(D), or blurred vision (E).

choices.text: Mirabegran acting as a beta 3 stimulant useful in managing post operative urinary retention
Oxybutynin acting M3 stimulant useful in overactive bladder
Bethanechol acting as M3 stimulant useful in managing urinary retention
Tamsulosin acting as a alpha 1 antagonist, useful in BPH

questions.text: Find out the true statement regarding action of drug mentioned at the site of arrow mark mentioned in the urinary bladder
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mirabegran acting as a beta 3 stimulant in the bladder, causes detrusor relaxation thereby useful in managing overactive bladder

Oxybutynin acting M3 antagonist useful in overactive bladder

Bethanechol acting as M3 stimulant useful in managing urinary retention

Tamsulosin acting as a alpha 1 antagonist, useful in BPH.  Tamsulosin acting on internal urethral sphincter not in the bladder

questions.text: Vivid dreams and nightmares are notable side effects of which of the following drug classes?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Vivid dreams and nightmares are notable side effects of beta-blockers, particularly lipophilic beta blockers that can readily have effects on the CNS – such as propranolol and metoprolol.

questions.text: A patient with essential hypertension requires a drug that reduces both cardiac output and peripheral resistance.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


carvedilol. Carvedilol is a nonselective
β-receptor antagonist and a selective α1-receptor
antagonist. It reduces cardiac output by blocking cardiac
β1-receptors and it decreases peripheral vascular
resistance by blocking α1-receptors in vascular smooth
muscle. Betaxolol (C) would reduce cardiac output but
not peripheral resistance.

questions.text: A 43-year-old man with severe depression has been taking a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor. He has recently experimented with several street drugs. He is now admitted to the emergency department with marked hyperthermia, tachycardia, and coma. What therapy should be initiated immediately for his serotonin syndrome?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


Dantrolene is useful in malignant hyperthermia, a syndrome
associated with volatile anaesthetics and succinylcholine. Diphenhydramine
is used parenterally in neuroleptic malignant syndrome,
a hyperthermic syndrome associated with antipsychotic
agents. Lasmiditan is a new 5-HT IF antagonist used in migraine

questions.text: A 50-year-old factory worker presents with cardio-respiratory symptoms and careful workup reveal idiopathic pulmonary hypertension. Which of the following binds endothelin receptors and is approved for use in pulmonary hypertension?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Aliskiren, a renin inhibitor, is used in primary hypertension.
Capsaicin, the "hot" constiruent of hot peppers, is the molecule
responsible for release of substance P. Conivaptan, an AVP
antagonist, is used in hyponatremia. Sacubitril, a ncprilysin
antagonist, is used in heart failure. Macitentan, an end.othelin
antagonist, is used in pulmonary hypertension.

questions.text: Which of the following is an antagonist at NK1 receptors and is used to prevent or reduce chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 

Aprepitant and ondansetron are both used to reduce or prevent

chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting. Ondansctron

is an antagonist at 5-HT3 receptors.

questions.text: Of the major serotonin (5-HT) receptors identified and used as targets for therapeutic agents, which one is the only one considered a ligand-gated ion channel?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

5-HT3. 
This type of receptor for serotonin
is famous as the only biogenic amine receptor that
is ionotropic. The other answers, A through C and E,
are all types of metabotropic receptors, also known as G
protein-coupled receptors.

questions.text: Which of the following drugs is the same as PGI2 (prostacyclin) and is used for the treatment of pulmonary hypertension?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Epoprostenol is the
same substance as PGI2 (prostacyclin) and is used for the
treatment of pulmonary hypertension. Answer A, misoprostol,
is a synthetic PGE1 analogue that is available in
an orally administered formulation for the prevention
of NSAID-induced gastric ulcers and duodenal ulcers.
Answer B, alprostadil, is a naturally occurring prostaglandin
but is known as PGE1.

questions.text:
Find out the true and false statement

A.    lumiracoxib is withdrawn because of the cardiovascular complications

B.    Piroxicam is short acting NSAID 

C.    Nabumetone is the prodrug

D.    IV indomethacin is useful to maintain the patency of patent ductus arteriosus 

E.    NSAID decrease the actions of lithium
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

rofecoxib, valdecoxib, and lumiracoxib were withdrawn worldwide because of the cardiovascular complications caused by suppression of cardioprotective COX-2–derived PGs, especially PGI2 , and the unrestrained effects of endogenous stimuli, such as platelet COX-1–derived TxA2 , on platelet activation, vascular proliferation and remodeling, hypertension, and atherogenesis

PIROXICAM undergoes enterohepatic recirculation. Estimates of the t 1/2 in plasma have been variable; the average is about 50 h
Nabumetone is the prodrug of 6-methoxy-2-naphthylacetic acid. Nabumetone is approved for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis and osteoarthritis.

indomethacin is approved for closure of persistent patent ductus arteriosus in premature infant

Patients taking lithium should be monitored because NSAIDs, including aspirin, reduce the renal excretion of this drug and can lead to toxicity

questions.text: Which one of the following drug useful in bronchial asthma targeting against IL-4?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

IL- 5 BLOCKERS-

MEPOLIZUMAB, RESLIZUMAB and BENRALIZUMAB-

IL- 4 blocker

DUPILUMAB – it is also useful for ATOPIC DERMATITIS

IL- 13 blockers

TRALOKINUMAB IL, LEBRIKIZUMAB

IgE blocker

 OMALIZUMAB

questions.text: Which drug used for the treatment of asthma inhibits 5-lipoxygenase?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

 zileuton. and decreases formation of all leukotrienes, including
leukotrienes LTB4, LTC4, LTD4, and LTE4. Theophylline
(A) is a nonspecific phosphodiesterase inhibitor, whereas
roflumilast (E) is a specific type IV phosphodiesterase
inhibitor. Zafirlukast (C) blocks receptors for cysteinyl
leukotrienes, and fluticasone (D) is a corticosteroid.

questions.text:
Find out the true and false statements

A.    A 6yr old child on growth hormone therapy is advised to undergo periodic fundoscopic examination 

B.    Cabergoline is preferred over bromocriptine in the treatment of prolactinoma

C.    Atosiban is the oxytocin receptor antagonist useful as a tocolytic

D.    Teduglutide useful in bowl cancer

E.    Radioactive iodine is useful in medullary caner of thyroid
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


Growth hormone therapy cause side effect of increasing intra cranial tension, so periodic fundus examination should be done to rule out papilledema

Cabergoline is the longer acting dopaminergic agonist, and having lesser side effect than bromocriptine, so cabergoline is the preferred dopaminergic agonist for treating prolactinoma

Atosiban is the oxytocin receptor antagonist useful as a tocolytic

Teduglutide is the GLP 2 agonist, useful in short bowel syndrome causing side effect of bowel cancer

Radioactive iodine 131 not taken up by the para follicular C cell, so not useful in medullary cancer of thyroid

Associated with risk of megaloblastic anaemia- Metformin

questions.text: Drug inhibiting 5 deiodinase and decreasing T3 level include all of the following except

questions.text:
Regarding etidronate find out the false and true statements

A.    Prevent hydroxyapatite dissolution

B.    Affects both normal and abnormal bone resorption

C.    Excreted through liver

D.    Causes adverse effects of hypercalcemia
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)


Etidronate sodium is used for treatment of Paget disease and may be used parenterally to treat hypercalcemia, undergo negligible hepatic clearance, and are excreted unchanged by the kidneys.  bisphosphonates prevent hydroxyapatite dissolution, The antiresorptive activity apparently involves two primary mechanisms: osteoclast apoptosis and inhibition of components of the cholesterol biosynthetic pathway

questions.text:
Regarding pioglitazone find out the true statement

A.    Pioglitazone contraindicated in kidney failure

B.    Can be used in active liver disease

C.    Contraindicated in moderate-to-severe heart failure

D.    Increased risk of bone fracture in women
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The thiazolidinediones are metabolized by the liver and may be administered to patients with renal insufficiency, but should not be used if there is active hepatic disease, Contraindicated in moderate-to-severe heart failure and increased risk of bone fracture in women

questions.text: Which of these drug classes is known to cause Fournier  gangrene?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

SGLT-2 inhibitors are oral antidiabetic drugs that promote the elimination of glucose in urine. Examples include canagliflozin, empagliflozin, and dapagliflozin. Fournier gangrene is an acute necrotic infection of the scrotum, penis, or perineum

questions.text: Regarding anti diabetic(GLP-1 analogues) drugs match the following
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)


Liraglutide a GLP 1 analogue approved for treatment of obesity

Semaglutide is the newer oral GLP1 analogue  

Albiglutide contains albumin in its struc¬ture so can induce antibody in some pa-tients. For the same reason it has been withdrawn from the market

Exenatide is the synthetic for of exendin 4, which is obtained from salivary gland venoum of gila monster

questions.text: Which one of the following DPP4 inhibitor is safe in renal failure?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Linagliptin 

If DPP-4 inhibitors are going to be used in patients with chronic kidney disease, lina¬gliptin is preferred because it is primarily eliminated via the enterohepatic system.

choices.text: a, b, c, & d are correct

questions.text:
Anti diabetic role in reducing risk of Cardiovascular mortality: 

A.    Cangliflozin  

B.    Metformin 

C.    Liraglutide 

D.    Pioglitazone
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Empagliflozin associated with a lower primary composite outcome of death from cardiovascular causes, nonfatal myocardi¬al infarction, or nonfatal stroke. Similar¬ly cangliflozin, dapagliflozin associated with decrease CV risk 

liraglutide reduced the risk of cardiovascular death, nonfatal myocardial infarction, or nonfatal stroke in patients with type 2 diabetes and established cardiovascular disease. Similar positive effects on cardiovascular risk have also been demonstrated in a trial of semaglutide, a compound in development with similarities to liraglutide. Other GLP-1 receptor agonists (exenatide and lixisenatide) are neutral with regards to cardiovascular risk in the trials completed to date

questions.text: All of the following insulin analogues are prepared by changes in the amino acid sequence only in B chain except
questions.solution:

Lispro, aspart and glulysine are prepared by modifying amino acid sequence only in B chain

Clargine prepared by modifying amino acid sequence both in A chain and B chain

TEDUGLUTIDE- is the GLP-2 analogue-useful in SHORT BOWL SYNDROME, given S/C injection 
Common adverse effects in clinical studies included abdominal discomfort (49% of patients), respiratory infections (28%), nausea (27%) and vomiting (14%), local reactions at the injection site (21%), and headache

questions.text: All of the following statements about octreotide are true except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Octreotide exerts pharmacologic actions similar to those of Somatostatin. Octre¬otide administered subcutaneously three times daily is 100% bioactive; peak ef¬fects are seen within 30 min, serum t1/2 is about 90 min, and duration of action is about 12 h. An equally effective long-act¬ing, slow-release form, octreotide LAR, is administered intramuscularly once every 4 weeks. It is used in acromegaly by re¬ducing GH secretion from pituitary

questions.text: All of the following are FDA approved medication for alcohol use disorder except
questions.solution:

questions.text: Which of the following aminoglycoside approved for inhalational use in refractory pulmonary MAC infection?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


Inhaled liposomal amikacin is now approved for use in refractory pulmonary MAC infections (persistent positive cultures after at least 6 months of treatment). It is currently being evaluated as a first-line agent and as a replacement for rifampin in the treatment of MAC lung disease.

three-drug regimen of azithromycin or clarithromycin, rifampin, and ethambutol in treatment-refractory (persistent sputum positivity after at least 6 months) MAC lung disease significantly increases culture conversion rates from 9 to 26% at 6 months

questions.text: From the given diagram (bacterial protein synthesis), find out the antimicrobial drug acting on the letter mentioned in 3
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

CHLORAMPHENICOL 

1. aminoglycosides, acting on 30S ribosomes, causing misreading of mRNA, and Initiation complex
Polysome formation

2. Tetracycline - acting on 30S ribosomes, inhibits Aminoacyl tRNA Attachment to A site

3. CHLORAMPHENICOL, binds with 50 S ribosome, inhibits Elongation of peptide chain Transfer of peptide chain from P to A site by inhibiting Peptidyl transferase
4. Macrolides, Lincosamides, Sreptogramins , binds with 50 S ribosome, inhibits translocation of elongated peptide chain from A to P site.

questions.text: Which one of the following drug useful in visceral leishmaniasis having teratogenic nature?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

miltefosine, which has been FDA-approved for cutaneous, mucocutaneous, and visceral disease for Leishmaniasis. Miltefosine also appears to have promise for treating dogs, an important animal reservoir of the disease . However, its teratogenic effects limit its utility in women of childbearing age. 

As an alternative, liposomal amphotericin B is a highly effective agent for visceral leishmaniasis  and is now recommended therapy in the U.S. in a recently released treatment guideline. 

In addition, paromomycin has been used with some success as a parenteral agent for visceral disease, and topical formulations of paromomycin have also been used for cutaneous disease (

questions.text: Regarding anticancer drugs and its adverse effects
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

BLEOMYCIN 
Most serious: pulmonary toxicity • Cutaneous toxicity (erythema, ulcerations, ( flagellated pigmentation on skin )) • Less myelosuppression than other cytotoxics

Capecitabine
hand and foot syndrome consists of erythema, desquamation, pain, and sensitivity to touch of the palms and soles, Capecitabine causes a similar spectrum of toxicities as 5FU (diarrhea, myelosuppression), but the hand-foot syndrome occurs more frequently and may require dose reduction or cessation of therapy
Dactinomycin
; dermatological manifestations include alopecia, as well as erythema, desquamation, and increased inflammation and pigmentation in areas previously or concomitantly subjected to X-ray
Busulfan
prolonged (up to years) pancytopenia; suppression of stem cells; seizures; ↑ clearance of phenytoin; hepatic VOD

Cyclophosphamide causes haemorrhagic cystitis, SIADH

questions.text: Which one of the following is the hematopoietic stem cell mobilizer?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)


Plerixafor is an immunostimulant used to mobilize hematopoietic stem cells in cancer patients into the bloodstream. The stem cells are then extracted from the blood and transplanted back to the patient

Eltrombopag is a medication that has been developed for certain conditions that lead to thrombocytopenia

voxelotor is the first hemoglobin oxygen-affinity modulator. Voxelotor has been shown to have disease-modifying potential by increasing hemoglobin levels and decreasing hemolysis indicators in sickle cell patients

Anagrelide capsules are indicated for the treatment of patients with thrombocythemia, secondary to myeloproliferative neoplasms, to reduce the elevated platelet count and the risk of thrombosis and to ameliorate associated symptoms including thrombo-hemorrhagic events

questions.text: Match the following
questions.solution:

Rituximab – targeting against CD 20 on B- lymphocytes and suppresses its function, abatacept is fusion protein targeting against CD80/86 on T lymphocytes and inhibits T cell activation, rilonacept is IL-1  blocker, sarilumab is the IL- 6 blocker.

questions.text: Which one of the following immunosuppressant needs dosage adjustments when given with allopurinol?

Azathioprine and 6 mercaptopurine un¬dergoes metabolism by xanthine oxidase, so these drugs need dosage adjustment when given with allopurinol (xanthine ox¬idase inhibitor)
